Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to prove that the RSS is carrying out relief work in Uttarakhand after the 2021 glacier break.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photograph being circulated is actually from 2013, not from the recent glacier break incident.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the RSS workers in the photograph were involved in relief work during the floods in Uttarakhand in 2013, not the recent glacier break incident.
Understate: The claim may understate the extent of the relief work being carried out by the RSS, as it only mentions them carrying sacks on their backs without providing further details.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the role of the RSS in relief work by stating that they have been doing it for three days to prevent hunger and disease, without sufficient evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the RSS workers in the photograph are carrying out relief work after the glacier break, without verifying the accuracy of the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting an eight-year-old photograph as evidence for relief work after the recent glacier break, which is misleading.
